channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says U.K. return of Chagos Islands to Mauritius is reason to acquire Greenland
item.description: The president previously supported Britain's agreement to hand back sovereignty of the Indian Ocean archipelago, where the U.K. continues to lease the...

item.title: A Birthday Card Replica From Trump to Epstein Appears on the National Mall
item.description: An oversize card reproduces a suggestive birthday greeting from 2003, released as part of a congressional inquiry. President Trump has denied that he ...

item.title: 'The miracle': A 6-year-old walked away from the train wreck that killed her family
item.description: Her parents, brother and cousin were killed in the collision, but the girl was found walking barefoot on the tracks. She's being cared for by grandpar...

item.title: University of Pennsylvania Rebukes Trump Administration for Demanding Information About Jewish Staff
item.description: The federal government has sued the University of Pennsylvania for information on its Jewish employees. The university said the request recalls a “fri...

item.title: We’re Still Talking About Bernie Goetz After All These Years
item.description: Two new books return to the ’80s-era saga of Bernie Goetz to consider the 21st-century intersections of race, crime and sensationalism.

item.title: Here's who's canceled their Kennedy Center performances since Trump took over
item.description: The Martha Graham Dance Company is just the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.

item.title: The divorce between the U.S. and WHO is final this week. Or is it?
item.description: The U.S. is the only country allowed to withdraw from the World Health Organization. And Jan. 22 is the day when Trump's pullout announcement should g...

item.title: Comer Rejects Clinton Interview on Epstein, Setting Up Contempt Vote
item.description: The Republican chairman of the Oversight Committee refused an offer to interview the former president under oath, rejecting terms he said were unreaso...

item.title: ASEAN won't endorse election in military-ruled Myanmar, Malaysia says
item.description: Malaysia's foreign minister Mohamad Hasan cited concerns over the lack of inclusive and free participation.

item.title: Israel Seizes UNRWA’s Jerusalem Headquarters
item.description: Bulldozers leveled some structures in a compound that belonged to UNRWA, the United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees, escalating Israel’s crack...

item.title: Stocks Post Biggest Drop in Months as Tensions Over Greenland Mount
item.description: The S&P 500 dropped over 2 percent on Tuesday, its biggest decline since October.

item.title: Islamic State Claims Deadly Attack on Chinese Restaurant in Afghanistan
item.description: A bombing that killed seven people and injured a dozen more at a noodle restaurant in a busy area of Kabul is likely to heighten China’s growing secur...

item.title: Scientists Set Up Camp on Thwaites Glacier in Antarctica
item.description: Low clouds have lifted long enough for helicopters to ferry scientists and their gear to a fast-melting glacier on the edge of Antarctica.

item.title: Trump, Venezuela and Oil
item.description: The president’s message since sending troops into Venezuela has been clear: This is about oil, not democracy.

item.title: For Syria’s Government, Kurdish Deal Is a Big Win on Shaky Ground
item.description: The government’s move to assert control over areas under Kurdish rule is a major test for President Ahmed al-Sharaa as fresh clashes erupted.
